comments.author: The Other Tiger
comments.content: The egg is added about halfway through the baking, then when it reaches an "over-easy" consistency, the cooks spread it around the pie. Wow. I hadn't looked closely at the photo before I scrolled down to start reading, and so I was thinking, "Oh, yeah, an egg in the center of a pizza...seen that." But the smearing of the egg, that's awesome. We don't live too far away from there, and I've been thinking about checking them out, but now I know I have to go. And bring a mix tape with me.

comments.author: Ian
comments.content: I discovered this post on TasteSpotting and thought the pizza looked gorgeous and sounded delicous. When I clicked over to this website and saw that FSPC is in Seattle and then realized that I too am in Seattle...well, I almost jumped out of my seat. I know what I'm having this weekend!

comments.author: Fairly Odd Tofu Mom
comments.content:
I'm excited. They have an actual VEGAN PIZZA listed on the menu!! No "please-leave-the-butter-the-eggs-the-cheese-the-whatever" off my pizza to make it vegan... they actually have one - and many options I could easily make vegan with little trouble. I'm in love.
Thank you (Yes, I know, your original post has EGGS in it and so not vegan, but I like exploring options regardless of what the original recipe is...)
